page.title: 14 A CHILD'S DAY
page.content: My name is Nerys Coward and I am ten years old. I get up at seven thirty and put on my school uniform. Then I go down stairs and have breakfast with my brother, Paul. For breakfast I have a bowl of "Frosties" or a piece of toast. I then brush my teeth and wash my face. At half-past eight I go to school on my bicycle. We have no cooked lunch at school now so I take a packed lunch which usally contains sandwiches, a biscuit and a packet of crisps. We leave school at three thirty-five p.m. and come home. We have tea at half-past five and after tea I amuse myself until I go to bed at nine o'clock. Usually I read before I go to bed, but on Tuesdays and Thursdays I am allowed to watch television for about half an hour. By Nerys Coward.
